questions.question: I think we should buy ……………………… car.
questions.description: Another means besides this / an alternative.

questions.question: You never think of …………………………..
questions.description: Others can mean the other people.

questions.question: ………………………… they refuse to admit it, their marriage is on the verge of collapse.
questions.description: We use although to connect two contrasting ideas. It is a conjunction and connects clauses.

questions.question: Stop fooling …………………………. We are already late.
questions.description: To fool around/about is to indulge in silly or time-wasting activities.

questions.question: I will love her as long as I ………………………….
questions.description: After as long as we use a present tense to refer to the future.

questions.question: We are painting the house ………………………… Easter.
questions.description: We use at to talk about the whole of holidays.

questions.question: If we want to get there by evening, we ………………………….. hurry.
questions.description: Had better is used to give strong advice.

questions.question: She was brought ………………………… by her maternal grandmother.
questions.description: To bring up a child is to raise her.

questions.question: There is something ………………………. the bed.
questions.description: Under and underneath can both refer to physical position.

questions.question: You cannot but ……………………… her courage.
questions.description: We use the infinitive without to after cannot but.

questions.question: How ………………………… money do you earn in a month?
questions.description: We use much before uncountable nouns.

questions.question: How …………………….. sisters do you have?
questions.description: We use many before plural nouns.
